intro: Oreoloma eglandulosum, commonly known as the smooth oreoloma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Oreoloma eglandulosum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
